titlestmt.subtitle: Papers, 1932-2008, of the National Theatre Conference at the Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana

change.item: A couple editorial changes made to the Biographical Note, as well as the Scope and Content Note.
Updated to schema and added Series IX. Additions.

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the National Theatre Conference mss., 1932-2008
titlepage.publisher: Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana
titlepage.p: © 2008 Trustees of Indiana University. All rights reserved.

did.head: Summary Information
did.abstract: Consists of the papers of past presidents, executive secretary and treasurer of the National Theatre Conference.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Prior arrangements are not necessary before coming to the Library, however, patrons from out of town are encouraged to communicate with the Library in advance of their visits to ascertain availability of materials.
Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator of Manuscripts, Lilly Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], National Theatre Conference mss., Lilly Library, Indiana University, Bloomington, Indiana.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The National Theatre Conference is a co-operative organization of directors of American community and university theatres organized collectively to serve the non-commercial theatre.
For more information on the National Theatre Conference see Balio, Tino and Lee Norvell. The History of the National Theatre Conference. [n.p.], 1968.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Consists of the papers of past presidents, executive secretary and treasurer of the National Theatre Conference. They consist of the files of Barclay Spencer Leatham, 1900- , educator, from the central office and the correspondence of past presidents: Paul Baker, 1911- , theatre director; Gilmore Brown, 1886?-1960, theatre director; Paul Eliot Green, 1894-1981, playwright; Frederic Charles McConnell, 1890-1968, theatre director; Lee Roy Norvelle, 1892-1984, professor; Scott Jackson Parker, 1945- , theatre manager; and, Theodore Albert Viehman, 1889-1970 , theatre director. The papers of past president Sawyer Falk, 1898-1961, educator, are in the possession of the Syracuse University Library.

The collection was further enriched by David Harrison Stevens, 1884-1968 , educator, who donated a bound set of the National Theatre Conference Bulletin and a complete report of all grants made in theatre and drama by the Rockefeller Foundation; by Alexander Wyckoff, 1898-1995, actor, who sent his files of valuable information on the early history of the National Theatre Conference; by Frederic Charles McConnell's correspondence as treasurer and head of the fellowship project; and by Mrs. Hallie (Ferguson) Flanagan Davis, 1890-1969, dramatist, who sent her correspondence as chairman of the New Playwright Project.

Also included are papers pertaining to the Appraisal Project conducted by the National Theatre Conference, 1958-1965, and material dealing with dissertations, papers and replies to a questionnaire from members of the organization, 1945-1964.

arrangement.head: Arrangement/Organization
arrangement.p: The collection is organized into the following series: I. Correspondence; II. Community Theatre; III. University Theatre; IV. Placement Service; V. Conferences/meetings; VI. Miscellaneous; VII. Notebooks; VIII. Papers of past officers; and IX. Additions.

scopecontent.p: Contains correspondence and other materials related to their term of office.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by various officers of the National Theatre Conference.

did.unittitle: Brown, Gilmore: Correspondence, A-Z (4 folders); letters sent to all members; Membership files (26ff); election and membership data
Falk, Sawyer: 1934-1964 correspondence (3 folders); 1945-1952 photocopies - "originals in Syracuse University Library (4 folders)
Green, Paul: 1940-1945 correspondence (8 folders); general; wartime programs; Fort Bragg project; war writing; war service; soldier theatricals reports

McConnell, Frederick: Alphabetical files - A; ANTA-May writing project; Army play project, 1946-1948; B; Bulletin, 1944-1950 (8 folders); C; Coburn, C.; conference booklet; D-F (3 folders); Falk, S.; fellowship (3 folders); Freedley
Norvelle, Lee: Acquisition of papers for history of NTC, 1960-1964 (4 folders); general, 1947-1953 (2 folders); membership (2 folders); New Play project, 1946-1949
Norvelle, Lee (cont.): Placement Service; tryout studios, New York; Ways and Means Committee, 1944-1947 (2 folders); general correspondence, 1949-1958 (11 folders)
Norvelle Touring Company: bookings, 1947-1949 (6 folders); financial (3 folders); general, 1947-1948; publicity, 1947-1949 (2 folders); purchase requisitions (3 folders); royalties; talent

Parker, Scott Jackson: President; vice-President (Sidney Berger); Treasurer (Kevin Maifeld); Secretary (Gresdna Doty); agendas; annual meeting programs; archives - includes copy of The History of the National Theatre Conference, by Tino Balio and Lee Norvelle (National Theatre Conference, 1968); Board of Trustees handbook; code of regulations; correspondence and reference materials; luncheon; membership booklet; membership lists; minutes; newsletter; outstanding achievement award; Paul Green Award; Person of the Year; The Players; SWOT analysis; Stavis Award (2 folders)
Viehman, Theodore: general, 1960-1963 (5 folders); appraisal; constitution, by-laws, codes

Viehman, Theodore (cont.): ANTA (American National Theatre and Academy) (3 folders); AETA (American Educational Theatre Assoc.)/ACTA (American Community Theatre Assoc.); National Council of the Arts in Education; printed materials
National Theatre Conference Quarterly Bulletin: Apr. 1939, Oct. 1942, June 1943
National Theatre Conference Bulletin: May 1945, Nov. 1945, Mar. 1946, Oct. 1946, Apr. 1947, Oct. 1947, Apr. 1948, July 1948, Nov. 1948 (2), Dec. 1949 (2), Mar. 1950, June 1950, Nov. 1950 (3 folders)
Bound volumes: General Education Board: Directory of Fellowship Awards for the Years, 1922-1950 [and] The Rockefeller Foundation: Directory of Fellowship Awards for the Years 1917-1950
Office of the President – To Do list
